did.abstract: The collection includes correspondence and documents pertaining to Edith Horton and her sister Alice Horton Stiles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Edith Horton lived on Macon Street in Brooklyn and was Principal of P.S. 7 in Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Edith Horton papers, 1977.472, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence from the New York City Department of Education to Edith Horton concerning contributions for the M. Samuel Stern Memorial Fund, which she chaired; a loyalty certificate; a deed between Edith's sister Alice Horton Stiles and Frank Swimm for land in the city of Brooklyn; a teaching certificate for Edith Horton; and a printed poem with a handwritten message on the back.
